title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 March 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:36 <polx> has quit  
00:54 <abusenius> has quit

00:57 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:58 <bbc581> has quit

08:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r9587817 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/9587817d7d392affefe89d51f9d7dc2456e7ac1a / (4 files in 4 dirs): XCOMMONS-133: Extension Manager should log a warning when there is ...  
09:04 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r29376da https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/29376da7724922053b31c6c4db3c3d1e8c6f59a5 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Fix warnings - http://git.io/VuzlwA  
09:11 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r12d1983 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/12d1983d50d8a68c2190d049dac3be9faa852cee / (2 files in 2 dirs): XCOMMONS-133: Extension Manager should log a warning when there is ...  
09:46 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r45e3831 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/45e3831210a3c418ab317c1980317d60e902403c / (4 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7633: Impossible to restart XWiki application alone without restarting the application server - http://git.io/SdzuRQ  
09:47 <CIA-120> tmortagne stable-3.5.x \* r2263db6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2263db69bfb10fa6417f98463f8a695f999815b5 / (4 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7633: Impossible to restart XWiki application alone without restarting the application server ...  
09:51 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r9891e09 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/9891e0983cd0dde1da52f0fae833b9ab82463c80 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-extension/xwiki-commons-extension-api/src/test/java/org/xwiki/extension/internal/DefaultExtensionManagerConfigurationTest.java : Fix test - http://git.io/Nsfd9A  
09:52 <+tmortagne> Hi guys  
09:52 <+tmortagne> it's release day today  
09:52 <+tmortagne> and the last Milestone  
09:53 <+tmortagne> could you please move jira issue that are not going to fit in 4.0  
09:54 <+tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/1169/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/UsersGroupsRightsManagementTest/testCreateAndDeleteGroup/ looks like a flickering test  
09:56 <+tmortagne> looking at what's wrong with platform  
09:58 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r79863b4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/79863b4378938725aa4c069a359209f6637775d5 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-cache/xwiki-platform-cache-infinispan/src/main/java/org/xwiki/cache/infinispan/internal/StopCacheManagerListener.java : Missing header - http://git.io/\_zZAqA  
09:58 <CIA-120> tmortagne stable-3.5.x \* ra3b0e78 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a3b0e78173160a6cedfeaac5829bb263bd82d342 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-cache/xwiki-platform-cache-infinispan/src/main/java/org/xwiki/cache/infinispan/internal/StopCacheManagerListener.java : Missing header ...  
09:59 <vmassol> good morning  
09:59 <vmassol> yep release day....  
10:00 <vmassol> we need to fix tests today  
10:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: just realizing that you've added a new job module in commons…. :)  
10:06 <vmassol> (don't recall a proposal/vote on this but I may just have missed it)  
10:07 <vmassol> there was no existing java library that we could have used for this?  
10:07 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <vmassol> I'm thinking about http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Concurrency/jobs-api.html for example (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8738160/eclipse-jobs-api-for-a-stand-alone-swing-project) but also http://java-source.net/open-source/job-schedulers  
10:09 <vmassol> I just want to be sure we've considered them and rejected them for a good reason  
10:10 <vmassol> (having our own interface is ok but here we're also talking about the implementation part which is ours)  
10:12 <vmassol> sending a mail  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:31 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <+tmortagne> vmassol: http://markmail.org/message/lcdx7nzr756jt3ob  
10:32 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <+tmortagne> it's not a scheduler  
10:32 <vmassol> I know  
10:32 <vmassol> but a scheduler does need the notion of jobs so all scheduler apis provide it  
10:32 <+sburjan> hello everyone  
10:32 <+tmortagne> and the implementation is minimalistic right now, it's actually mostly about having an API to make a thread expose inforrmation  
10:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: in this thread I don't remember the mention of creating a new jobs module  
10:33 <vmassol> (I remember seeing that thread)  
10:33 <+tmortagne>  \* Job Manager: encapsulate background task into a job providing progress and status informations as well as logging isolation. In it's own module.  
10:33 <vmassol> ah yes it says 'in its own module"  
10:33 <vmassol> I missed that part  
10:33 <vmassol> there's no rationale though  
10:33 <vmassol> explaining why we don't use an existing fwk  
10:34 <vmassol> when someone asks me why we created our own code I'd like to be able to answer him/her, so we need that information  
10:34 <vmassol> anyway I've sent an email  
10:34 <vmassol> so that we're all clear on this  
10:34 <+tmortagne> as I said the implementation does not do much right now, it's all about providing a API to let a thread indicate progression stuff  
10:34 <+tmortagne> we can choose whatever other implementation later  
10:34 <vmassol> (I'm not attacking your choice thomas, I just want to know and ensure we've done the right architecture choice)  
10:34 <vmassol> well I just looked at it  
10:34 <vmassol> and it has quite a lot of content  
10:35 <sburjan`> has quit  
10:35 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <+tmortagne> also I looked at quarks and I could not find anything related to progression/communication with a scheduled job other that start/pause/stop  
10:36 <+tmortagne> most of the content is plumbing  
10:36 <vmassol> anyway no need to answer here, you can answer in that thread when you have the time  
10:41 <CIA-120> tmortagne stable-3.5.x \* r7864a33 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7864a3320e37eb3025703eaa0c9aaa98ef240bb0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-cache/xwiki-platform-cache-infinispan/src/main/java/org/xwiki/cache/infinispan/internal/StopCacheManagerListener.java : XWIKI-7633: Impossible to restart XWiki application alone without restarting the application server ...  
11:00 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <jvelo> hi guys  
11:09 <jvelo> still time for a small commit before the release ?  
11:09 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rc494f7d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c494f7d94276e6b5a554bc95610b58ba95b7c2b7 / (5 files in 2 dirs): Replace "Advanced install" with "Advanced search" in preparation for the async install. ...  
11:09 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <+tmortagne> jvelo: sure, will probably start after lunch but not before  
11:10 <+tmortagne> btw anyone has something blocker remaining to commit before the release ?  
11:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: are all tests ok?  
11:11 <jvelo> tmortagne, ok thanks  
11:11 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I only seen something that looks like a flickering test  
11:11 <+tmortagne> in test-selenium  
11:12 <vmassol> ok then we're in a better state than I thought :)  
11:12 <+tmortagne> me too  
11:12 <+tmortagne> was pretty suprised  
11:12 <+tmortagne> platform build is red but should be ok in next build  
11:13 <+tmortagne> (platform 3.5)  
11:13 <vmassol> @marius: why advanced search?  
11:13 <vmassol> (since it's an advanced install and there's no search)  
11:14 <vmassol> if we're talking about the link on the right when in the EM UI  
11:14 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it used to but from what I understood mflorea actually changed it so that it look like search result instead now  
11:14 <+tmortagne> more consistent  
11:14 <vmassol> so how do I install a specific extension?  
11:15 <+tmortagne> you just have one more step  
11:15 <+tmortagne> you get the classical detailed information and click in install  
11:15 <+tmortagne> s/in/on/  
11:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: you search for it and if it exists you install it like you do with other extensions  
11:15 <vmassol> so I have to search for something I know already?  
11:15 <vmassol> you mean I cannot install something I know anymore?  
11:16 <+mflorea> ofc you can  
11:16 <+tmortagne> again you get one more step  
11:16 <+tmortagne> with detailed informations  
11:16 <+mflorea> if the extension is found it will have the install button next to it  
11:16 <vmassol> with all versions?  
11:16 <vmassol> because I use that to install older versions for ex  
11:16 <+tmortagne> you mean with specified version ?  
11:17 <vmassol> and the search never works  
11:17 <+Denis> tmortagne: XWIKI-7309 has not been solved, sorry I do not had time to look at it, maybe it should be fixed, wdyt ?  
11:17 <vmassol> yep  
11:17 <+tmortagne> it's not a really search  
11:17 <+mflorea> advanced install = you get the exact extension you want, so exact version  
11:17 <+tmortagne> it just look like a search result  
11:17 <vmassol> ok I see  
11:17 <vmassol> not sure it's a good idea but ok  
11:18 <vmassol> I understand the consistency  
11:18 <+tmortagne> Denis: if it's a migration issue seems pretty important yes  
11:18 <+tmortagne> are you working on it ?  
11:18 <+Denis> no  
11:20 <+Denis> oh, sorry  
11:21 <+tmortagne> ?  
11:21 <+Denis> tmortagne: I would like to talk about XWIKI-7628 which was simple, mismatch  
11:22 <+tmortagne> yep looks like an easy fix  
11:22 <+tmortagne> do you want to take care of this or should I looks at it ?  
11:23 <+tmortagne> hmm  
11:23 <+tmortagne> actually not that easy  
11:23 <+tmortagne> since we don't have  the document at this level  
11:24 <+tmortagne> well depends  
11:24 <+tmortagne> we have it for objects  
11:25 <+tmortagne> so we could fix it for them at least  
11:25 <+Denis> we pass it to the resolver, we should have it  
11:25 <+Denis> what is wrong is to prefer the current wiki to the wiki of the passed refs  
11:25 <+tmortagne> yes I see that we pass it  
11:26 <+tmortagne> so I don't see what's wrong  
11:26 <+tmortagne> that does not make sense  
11:26 <+tmortagne> the passed reference should always have the priority  
11:26 <+Denis> the current resolver prioritize de current wiki over the wiki of the reference  
11:26 <+tmortagne> that's a bug IMO  
11:26 <+tmortagne> it should never do that  
11:26 <+tmortagne> the reference is supposed to have absolute priority  
11:27 <+Denis> this is one of its specificity according to the javadoc  
11:27 <vmassol> that would be a huge bug, I'm surprised  
11:27 <+tmortagne> does not make any sense to me, looking at it  
11:28 <vmassol> but indeed I can see it's doing that in the code  
11:28 <vmassol> CurrentEntityReferenceValueProvider  
11:28 <vmassol> wait  
11:28 <vmassol> maybe not  
11:28 <vmassol> need to check when getDefaultValue is called  
11:28 <+tmortagne> I don't see anything in the javadoc  
11:28 <+tmortagne> it should not even call that method  
11:28 <+tmortagne> because the abstract is supposed to find the wiki in the provided reference  
11:29 <vmassol> ep  
11:29 <vmassol> yep  
11:29 <+tmortagne> there is nothing in the code or in the javadoc making it an on purpose behavior  
11:29 <vmassol> let's check unit tests  
11:29 <+tmortagne> looking at unit tests  
11:30 <vmassol> can't find any unit tests for the current resolver....  
11:31 <+tmortagne> yep  
11:31 <+tmortagne> maybe there is only test for the abstract  
11:31 <+tmortagne> but not sure where  
11:32 <vmassol> checking that with code coverage in my ide :)  
11:32 <+tmortagne> it's probably in platform-model  
11:32 <+tmortagne> trying to reproduce  
11:33 <+tmortagne> Denis: I can't reproduce the issue in a unit test  
11:33 <vmassol> AbstractStringEntityReferenceResolver is indeed tested well indirectly by all other tests  
11:34 <+tmortagne> I passed a new WikiReference("otherwiki") in one of the CurrentStringEntityReferenceResolverTest tests and it's taken into account  
11:34 <vmassol> (only 1 line not tested)  
11:34 <+tmortagne> so that's not the real issue here, did you debugged it and seen this behavior ?  
11:35 <vmassol> but CurrentEntityReferenceValueProvider is not tested at all that's bad  
11:35 <vmassol> ah wait that's in oldcore  
11:35 <+tmortagne> yes  
11:35 <+tmortagne> and it's tested in CurrentStringEntityReferenceResolverTest  
11:35 <+tmortagne> I guess  
11:36 <+tmortagne> getDocumentReference() return a DocumentReference so there is no way it does not contain a WikiReference  
11:36 <+tmortagne> so I don't see how you can have this behavior actually  
11:37 <+tmortagne> unless the Object does not have the proper document reference  
11:37 <+tmortagne> so that would be a bug in the cloe  
11:37 <+tmortagne> clonee  
11:37 <+tmortagne> clone  
11:38 <+tmortagne> also "it breaks the creation of subwikis in XEM based on an existing wiki" are you talking about creating a wiki from wik itemplate ?  
11:38 <+Denis> true  
11:38 <+tmortagne> I created several just several days ago in myxwiki.org so it works well on 3.5 at least  
11:38 <vmassol> mflorea/tmortagne: could you look at this one: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/1189/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.escaping/ApplicationTest/XWiki\_\_AddExtensions\_xml\_\_searchextension\_u002C\_ajax\_u002C\_actionuninstall\_u002C\_extensionversion\_u002C\_language\_u002C\_comment\_u002C\_actioninstall\_u002C\_extensionid\_\_\_testParametersInColibri/  
11:38 <vmassol> it's possible tehre's a real problem  
11:38 <vmassol> Testing URL: http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/AddExtensions?searchextension=aaa%22bbb%27ccc%3Eddd%3Ceee&skin=colibri&language=en&form\_token=ZAcOcVMXNuyeFFT3vTJgng  
11:39 <vmassol> "Caused by: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out", maybe it's hanging or something  
11:39 <+mflorea> Caused by: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out  
11:39 <+mflorea> extensions wiki is hanging  
11:39 <vmassol> err?  
11:39 <+tmortagne> it's not supposed to be enabled at all  
11:39 <vmassol> no test should call the outside ofc  
11:39 <+mflorea> it is too slow  
11:39 <vmassol> mflorea: that's not right marius  
11:40 <vmassol> that's completely forbidden  
11:40 <vmassol> (to depend on external resources)  
11:40 <+tmortagne> that's weird it used to be properly disabled  
11:40 <+tmortagne> checking the xwiki.properties  
11:41 <+Denis> tmortagne: it only happen on 4.x  
11:41 <+tmortagne> vmassol: xwiki.properties is not modified it seems  
11:41 <+Denis> only 4.x use object reference to compute ids  
11:42 <+tmortagne> Denis: BaseCollection and resolver did not changed in 4.x AFAIK  
11:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: did you do it only for test-ui ? I tought it was for all actuallyu  
11:42 <+mflorea> vmassol: that URL loads instantly on my instance with only local maven repo enabled  
11:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdym?  
11:43 <+tmortagne> you changed integration test to disable extensions repositories  
11:43 <+tmortagne> I tough you did it for all tests  
11:44 <vmassol> I don't recall  
11:44 <+tmortagne> but looks like it's not disabled for this one  
11:44 <+Denis> tmortagne: the object reference used to base my object identifier in 4.x are wrong during wiki cloning  
11:44 <+tmortagne> so that's a clone bug then  
11:44 <CIA-120> Jerome Velociter master \* r2c5bc9d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2c5bc9d5f66dd1489cef0e8ca71c1d186eb8c62d / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-ldap/xwiki-platform-ldap-ui/pom.xml : XWIKI-2551 Create a LDAP administration app ...  
11:45 <+Denis> I though, that I have determined it was linked to what I have explained, but I may be wrong, anyway, I see no link between getting object reference and the way cloning would work  
11:46 <+Denis> mmm  
11:52 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it was for test-webstandards actually (because it was getting a timeout get validating the AddExtensions page), search how you did it  
11:53 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:54 <+tmortagne> found it  
11:54 <+tmortagne> it's in XWikiTestSetup  
11:55 <+tmortagne> so that's mean that test-escaping does not use it  
11:55 <+tmortagne> sounds weird  
11:55 <+tmortagne> it's probably the only one  
12:00 <+tmortagne> actually it's the other way around...  
12:10 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:11 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
12:20 <+Denis> tmortagne: I have setup a test, I will debug, this is really puzzling me...  
12:25 <+tmortagne> Denis: ok cool  
12:26 <mflorea> has quit  
12:28 <+Denis> tmortagne: we do not tag anymore our release ? I should I checkout the M1 source code ?  
12:29 <+tmortagne> Denis: there should be a tag  
12:30 <+tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/xwiki-platform-4.0-milestone-1  
12:30 <+tmortagne> you probably forgot to putt --tags in your git pull/fetch  
12:30 <+Denis> oh, though that —tags was for push, not pull  
12:32 <+tmortagne> I don't know about push but pull/fetch just fetch branches by default  
12:33 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r8f06e12 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/8f06e126a76a79103169335fdc7f1b064876a6ba / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/escaping/framework/SingleXWikiExecutor.java : Disable external extensions repositories for tests - http://git.io/gz063Q  
12:38 <+Denis> tmortagne: together, we have the whole picture :)  
12:39 <+tmortagne> :)  
13:06 <polx> has quit  
13:22 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:26 <+Denis> tmortagne: seems the issue is effectively note related to the resolver but to the relative xclass reference that is all but relative  
13:34 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <evalica> has quit  
13:38 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:38 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
13:45 <+tmortagne> Denis: ok  
13:47 <+Denis> tmortagne: in fact there is nothing that ensure we set relative reference, and nothing that ensure that getRelativeXClassReference will not return a absolute reference set earlier  
13:52 <+tmortagne> Denis: of course since it does not have to be relative  
13:53 <+tmortagne> if you want a class from another wiki for example  
13:53 <+Denis> but this is currently not supported  
13:53 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <+tmortagne> I mean it is relative but it can be absolute  
13:53 <+tmortagne> Denis: not by the model  
13:53 <+tmortagne> anyway the issue is not there  
13:54 <+Denis> it is mostly always absolute, while store relatively in the database, which means we have a terrile inconsistency  
13:54 <+tmortagne> then it mean the load is not right  
13:54 <+Denis> the issue is that getRelativeXClassReference should be relative, or the result of the function is really unexpected  
13:55 <+Denis> the load, mostly load absolute reference  
13:55 <+tmortagne> the store should provide a relative reference and not an absolute one in loadXWikiDocument  
13:55 <+Denis> but, has you said this is not the real issue  
13:55 <+tmortagne> well kind of  
13:55 <+tmortagne> if the reference is absolute then it copied as such  
13:56 <+tmortagne> if it's explicitely absolute the there is no reason to modify it to another wiki  
13:56 <+tmortagne> so yes the issue is in the load if the goal is not have relative reference with this store impl  
13:57 <+Denis> at least, it goes wrong because collection.setXClassReference(getRelativeXClassReference()); does not do what you expect  
13:58 <+tmortagne> what do you expect ?  
13:58 <+tmortagne> relative does not mean local  
13:58 <+Denis> to set it relative  
13:59 <+tmortagne> relative is what is explicitly indicated, like in a link  
13:59 <+Denis> relative means relative to the document  
13:59 <+tmortagne> it's not relative to the document  
13:59 <+tmortagne> no  
13:59 <+tmortagne> it's not  
13:59 <+tmortagne> not in this API  
13:59 <+tmortagne> that's not the goal  
13:59 <+tmortagne> ot it would be totally useless  
13:59 <+Denis> clone is wrong than  
13:59 <+tmortagne> clone is right if it clones it as it is  
13:59 <+tmortagne> which seems tobe your issue  
14:00 <+tmortagne> no again what's wrong is the initial set in the load IMO, if the class is supposed to be "the class toto in the same wiki" then the store should set it that way  
14:00 <+tmortagne> and not set an absolute reference  
14:01 <+tmortagne> it's wokring exactly like the parent reference  
14:02 <+tmortagne> I guess the UI to add object should be checked too for the same mistake (unless it's using the old String based API probably)
